author: Ed Crocker
description:
I feel like there’s an increasing subgenre in horror in which what starts off as true crime eventually descends into cosmic horror. The fantastic King’s Hill by Josh Hanson is a recent example of this, and though I don’t have any more examples off the top of my head, that won’t stop me from spreading […]

title: REVIEW: The Sound of the Dark by Daniel Church

author: Dr. Kristi Charish
description:
Where space travel is concerned, the things we don’t know are most likely to kill us Thirty or so years ago, my dad gave me a cardboard box full of classic sci-fi novels: Heinlein, Edgar Rice Burroughs, Isaac Asimov (that inspired The Foundation TV series). Even though some were only twenty odd years old at […]

title: Space: We’re Probably All Going to Die
